questions.question: What is the primary difference between a 'relational' and 'non-relational' database?
options: Relational databases use tables, non-relational use documents/key-pairs
questions.correctAnswer: Relational databases use tables, non-relational use documents/key-pairs

questions.question: Which of these is a popular stack for Full Stack Development?
questions.correctAnswer: All of the above

questions.question: What does CORS stand for?
questions.correctAnswer: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing

questions.question: In a MERN stack, what does 'E' stand for?
questions.correctAnswer: Express

questions.question: Which HTTP method is typically used to create a new resource?
questions.correctAnswer: POST

questions.question: What is usage of 'npm'?
questions.correctAnswer: Node Package Manager

questions.question: Which of these is a frontend framework?
questions.correctAnswer: React

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git?
questions.correctAnswer: Version Control

questions.question: What is 'State' in React?
options: An object that determines how that component renders & behaves
questions.correctAnswer: An object that determines how that component renders & behaves

questions.question: What protects passwords in a database?
questions.correctAnswer: Encryption/Hashing

questions.question: Where is the best place to store JWT tokens in the browser?
questions.correctAnswer: HttpOnly Cookie

questions.question: What is 'Server-Side Rendering' (SSR)?
options: Rendering HTML on the server and sending it to the client
questions.correctAnswer: Rendering HTML on the server and sending it to the client

questions.question: How do you prevent SQL Injection?
questions.correctAnswer: Using Parameterized Queries / Prepared Statements

questions.question: What is a 'RESTful' API?
options: An API that adheres to REST architectural constraints
questions.correctAnswer: An API that adheres to REST architectural constraints

questions.question: Explain 'Continuous Integration' (CI).
options: Automating the integration of code changes from multiple contributors
questions.correctAnswer: Automating the integration of code changes from multiple contributors

questions.question: What is the difference between 'Authentication' and 'Authorization'?
options: AuthN verifies identity, AuthZ verifies permissions
AuthN verifies permissions, AuthZ verifies identity
AuthN is for users, AuthZ for servers
questions.correctAnswer: AuthN verifies identity, AuthZ verifies permissions

questions.question: Which command initializes a new Node.js project?
questions.correctAnswer: npm init

questions.question: In a 3-tier architecture, what are the tiers?
questions.correctAnswer: Presentation, Logic, Data

questions.question: What is Docker used for?
questions.correctAnswer: Containerization

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'middleware'?
options: To handle requests between client and server logic
questions.correctAnswer: To handle requests between client and server logic

questions.question: How does GraphQL differ from REST?
options: GraphQL allows clients to request exactly the data they need
questions.correctAnswer: GraphQL allows clients to request exactly the data they need

questions.question: What is WebSockets used for?
questions.correctAnswer: Real-time, two-way communication

questions.question: What is 'Prop Drilling'?
options: Passing props through multiple levels of components
questions.correctAnswer: Passing props through multiple levels of components

questions.question: Which hook manages state in functional components?
questions.correctAnswer: useState

questions.question: What is 'Lazy Loading'?
options: Loading resources only when they are needed
questions.correctAnswer: Loading resources only when they are needed

questions.question: What is a 'Single Page Application' (SPA)?
options: A web app that loads a single HTML page and dynamically updates
questions.correctAnswer: A web app that loads a single HTML page and dynamically updates

questions.question: What is the use of 'async/await'?
options: To handle asynchronous code in a clearer way
questions.correctAnswer: To handle asynchronous code in a clearer way

questions.question: What is 'Responsive Design'?
options: Design that adapts to different screen sizes
questions.correctAnswer: Design that adapts to different screen sizes

questions.question: Which database is Key-Value store?
questions.correctAnswer: Redis

questions.question: What is 'Horizontal Scaling'?
options: Adding more machines to the pool of resources
Adding more power to a single machine
questions.correctAnswer: Adding more machines to the pool of resources

questions.question: What is the CAP Theorem?
options: It is impossible for a distributed data store to simultaneously provide more than two out of Consistency, Availability, and Partition tolerance
questions.correctAnswer: It is impossible for a distributed data store to simultaneously provide more than two out of Consistency, Availability, and Partition tolerance

questions.question: Explain 'Event Loop' in Node.js.
options: Single-threaded loop that handles async callbacks
questions.correctAnswer: Single-threaded loop that handles async callbacks

questions.question: What is 'Optimistic UI'?
options: Updating the UI immediately before the server responds
questions.correctAnswer: Updating the UI immediately before the server responds

questions.question: What is 'Database Normalization'?
options: Organizing data to reduce redundancy and improve integrity
questions.correctAnswer: Organizing data to reduce redundancy and improve integrity

questions.question: What is 'Microservices' vs 'Monolith'?
options: Microservices split app into small services, Monolith is one codebase
questions.correctAnswer: Microservices split app into small services, Monolith is one codebase

questions.question: What is 'CSRF'?
questions.correctAnswer: Cross-Site Request Forgery

questions.question: What is 'XSS'?
questions.correctAnswer: Cross-Site Scripting

questions.question: What is a 'Race Condition'?
options: When system behavior depends on the sequence or timing of uncontrollable events
questions.correctAnswer: When system behavior depends on the sequence or timing of uncontrollable events

questions.question: What is 'BFF' pattern?
questions.correctAnswer: Backend For Frontend

questions.question: How to handle 'Backpressure' in streams?
options: Pause the producer or buffer data
questions.correctAnswer: Pause the producer or buffer data

questions.question: What is 'Idempotency'?
options: Operation applied multiple times has the same effect as once
questions.correctAnswer: Operation applied multiple times has the same effect as once

questions.question: What is 'Tree Shaking'?
questions.correctAnswer: Removing unused code during build

questions.question: What is 'Content Security Policy' (CSP)?
options: Security layer to detect and mitigate attacks like XSS
questions.correctAnswer: Security layer to detect and mitigate attacks like XSS

questions.question: What is 'ACID' properties?
questions.correctAnswer: Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability

questions.question: What is 'Blue-Green Deployment'?
questions.correctAnswer: Running two identical production environments
